Text.Value: I'm still looking to shift some supplies. Don't have much to spare, but it's more than we can carry.
Back, beast! Back!

EditorData.logicalname: INCLUSION LINE - KARLACH COMPANION AND NEARBY

Text.Value: Leave.
I'll take those supplies now - and everything else you own.
Need any supplies? We've fewer mouths to feed now.

EditorData.NodeContext: Friendly, with a hint of regret - that 'one less mouth to feed' is dead in the next room

Text.Value: How many did you lose?
Talk to Anders if you want the details. I don't have it in me to recount the horror.
After you did us such a good turn, perhaps I can be of use to you, too.
Tyr be with you.
Blessings for the road ahead.
Ye gods - come back for us, have you, devil? Anders! The beast has returned!

EditorData.NodeContext: First to Karlach, then calling up and over his left shoulder to Anders

Text.Value: I pray their souls have returned to Tyr's grace.
Hunting her down? Trying to survive her, more like. You can't listen to a devil like that. They'll pour poison in your ear and say it's honey.
The Lord of Justice sent us after a devil haunting this area. We squared off against her. We lost.

EditorData.NodeContext: mildly indignant - heavy emphasis on 'slaughtered', light emphasis on 'one'.

Text.Value: Let's see what you have to trade.
What happened to you?
Paladins of Tyr, are you? The ones hunting down a woman named Karlach?
I... yes. I hope so too. Thank you.

EditorData.NodeContext: voice catching - she's been told to have hope about the fate of a dead companion's soul and doesn't feel it

Text.Value: Keep that beast away from us - you hear?

EditorData.logicalname: INCLUSION LINE - KARLACH COMPANION AND NEARBY

Text.Value: Two. Both stalwarts of Tyr, sworn to uphold justice.
Me the beast? Now that's fucking rich.
Leave.
Oh, you fool. We'll destroy you.
Sure, I'll take your supplies - and everything else you own.
Kill the devil, if you can. Otherwise, leave well enough alone.
In Tyr's name.

Synopsis:
One of a group of refugees who sold their souls to the archdevil Zariel in exchange for the strength to survive their journey to Baldur's Gate. They've agreed to capture and kill Karlach, one of the origin characters, and if they do their souls will be their own again.

This refugee is confident of her chances of survival, but unnerved by the pact they signed.
